title: DHS Cyber Student Volunteer
description: • Selected among 1,700 honor students across the nation to participate in the 2014 Department of Homeland Security Secretary’s Honors Program, Cyber Student Volunteer Initiative Program. • Maintained an inventory of systems and components connected to the C-LAN. • Assisted the Information System Security Officer (ISSO) in collecting and maintaining the Atlantic Area (LANTAREA) SIPRNet accreditation documentation. • Under the guidance of U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) Telecommunications and Information Systems Command and the ISSO, ensured that the network is being operated per the approved accreditation. • Assessed projects with IA (Information Assurance) activities to keep their Security Authorizations on track and within the parameters set for a systems required level of risk acceptance. • Assessed system development by conducting security impact analysis to determine if system reaccreditation is warranted. • Updated LANTAREA’s units and cutters connectivity diagrams. • Analyzed LANTAREA’s vulnerability scan summary and helped to drive key business decisions within the USCG IA process. • Drafted valuable and cogent written products, and verbal briefings under pressure that were critical in finalizing superior recommendations supporting operational and budget decisions used by USCG senior leadership, and up to the DHS. • Understand Atlantic Area Command, Control, Computers, Information Technology, and Security Division complex and asymmetric networks and problem sets and determine the logical courses of action for a solution.

title: Management Analyst, SIGINT Analyst, & Contracting Officer Representative
description: • Coordinated and executed multiple intelligence capabilities projects in support of SOF counter narcotics operations. • Provided outstanding operation support to the United States Southern Command Director of Intelligence (SOUTHCOM), Intelligence Integration Strategy (IIS), Joint Interagency Task Force South, and U.S. Embassy Intelligence Fusion Cell (EIFC). • Diligently processed country clearances for incoming personnel to the EIFC. • Expertly provided simultaneous translation with the Red Team and translated documents for a partnership nation’s Minister of Defense and military intelligence officials. • Advised senior military officials on the proper implementation of intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) collection, processing, analysis, and dissemination efforts. • Served as the technical expert in the multidisciplinary fields of CI, security, and related subject matter areas as they pertain to insider threat. • Led air and ground collection asset for the Intelligence Integration Team (IIT), which restored secured communication allowing time sensitive and mission critical information to be passed to headquarters. • Served as a liaison and coordinated foreign national objective contracts to ensure uninterrupted intelligence efforts and provide information. • Drafted and briefed Concept of Operations (CONOPS) to the Senior Defense Officer and to the delegated Risk Determining Authority before deploying teams to remote, dangerous location. • Synchronized and finalized IIT property inventory; accounted for all the Team’s property books items located in multiple locations and ensured accurate reporting of findings.

title: Airborne Sensor Operator and Imagery Analyst (ASO/IA)
description: Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance Airborne Sensor Operator and Imagery Analyst (ASO/IA) supporting a new program for an Other Government Agency expected to be based OCONUS. Provide subject matter expertise for a manned aerial platform providing imagery and multi-source data for both real-time and after-action analysis. Responsible for the collection and analysis of multi-source information the majority of which will be processed in flight. I work with ELINT, E/O IR, hyper-spectral imagers and a variety of exploitation software tools. Forming, analyzing and mensurating imagery collected from one or more of the sensor suites. Inspect, troubleshoot, and assist with performing upgrades and maintenance.

title: Program Manager
description: Program Manager for the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Test and Evaluation (T&E) Mission Support Service (MSS) contract involving support to DISA and Joint Interoperability Test Command (JITC) for interoperability testing, information assurance and authority to operate certifications for DoD command, control and communication systems. Supporting Joint Information Environment (JIE), Joint Regional Security Stack (JRSS), and uniformed services and Nation Security Agency programs. DISA MSS is a large IDIQ contract with 18 delivery orders and over a dozen subcontractors across multiple work sites providing support to DoD acquisition information technology systems, conducting interoperability testing and information assurance evaluations. In addition, providing program management services necessary to plan and execute capture management strategies, plan, organize and execute proposal efforts in response to government requests for proposal, conduct the initial planning, organization and development of the project management plan for new start projects, and effective management oversight and control during execution of assigned contracts and task orders.

title: Senior Program Manager / Systems Engineer
description: Providing program management and systems engineering expertise in requirements, risk and resource management, change control, cost and schedule baselines, and configuration control for specialized multi-target tracking instrumentation radar development programs. * Supporting Engineering Change Proposals for STAR Dynamics’ X-Band Space Time Adaptive Radar (XSTAR) continuous wave tracking radar that is the centerpiece for the Army’s Range Radar Replacement Program (RRRP). * Program Manager for the Mobile Doppler Tracking System (MODOTS) program; a derivative of the XSTAR-series multi-object tracking radar. Monitoring and reporting risk, schedule and cost challenges related to radar system design and testing approaches. * Monitored and reported risk, schedule and cost challenges related to radar system design and testing approaches. Creating a large-scale aircraft testing laboratory and monitoring costs and performance against a $15M capital investment program, I expanded the firm’s market share, leveraging my relationships within the office of the Secretary of Defense. * Startup STAR Dynamics needed an airworthiness certificate to conduct their business. Managing a team of six, I led the development of maintenance and operations manuals and researched aircraft status, creating a Low Utilization Maintenance Program. * Onsite manager for Boeing 707 aircraft heavy “C” maintenance check for compliance with the maintenance inspection program, FAA Airworthiness Directives and applicable Service Bulletins to return aircraft to flyable status. I also worked to expand STAR Dynamics Corp’s presence and market share in the DoD range radar and range instrumentation areas. * Increased Product Awareness. Through personal contact network I increased visibility of their radar product capabilities to various DoD test ranges and Office of the Secretary of Defense range instrumentation resource organizations. Capture manager for the Army’s RRRP.

title: Senior EW Analyst
description: Assigned to Army G-3/5/7 and JIEDDO to provide experienced acquisition management and test engineering support as senior staff EW action officer. * Supported Joint Counter Radio Controlled Improvised Explosive Device Electronic Warfare (JCREW) program. Army G-3/5/7 representative to JCREW technical working group and Military Technical Acceptance Board. * Assisted in developing and documenting technical requirements and capabilities for Army’s proposed Integrated Electronic Warfare System. Utilized operational and programmatic experience in reviewing and staffing revisions to various Army Field Manuals, Regulations and Concept of Operations documents concerned with EW. * Utilized T&E experience to support JIEDDO Test Board with its oversight role of conducting performance testing of C-IED projects. Assisted project directors in developing/finalizing test plans, defining resource requirements, coordinating with test facilities and ranges, and participating in actual test events. * Provided EW and T&E expertise in supporting JIEDDO Theater Support Test initiatives to resolve operational mission compatibility issues between fielded Counter Radio Controlled Improvised Explosive Device Electronic Warfare (CREW) devices and other emitters operating in combat theater areas.

title: Program Manager / Systems Engineer
description: Promoted to lead the financial, technical and engineering support for the Army’s Big Crow Program Office (BCPO). Designated as senior staff action officer; represented BCPO in meetings with senior staff of numerous DoD organizations, including: Under Secretary of Defense for Acquisition, Technology and Logistics; Program Analysis and Evaluation, and Joint Chiefs of Staff. * Coordinated various requirements definition and validation, design, modification, installation and integration efforts of mission systems on NKC-135 aircraft in support of numerous customer’s operational and test requirements. * Managed engineering efforts to design, install and integrate advanced telemetry and side-looking, multiple target tracking radar capabilities on a B-707 aircraft to serve as a RDT&E platform for DoD, NASA and other government agencies. * Structural modifications were reviewed through in-house Configuration Control Board and staffed to AFMC for final sign off.

title: Project Manager
description: Managed all financial and contractual aspects of EWA GSI’s Test and Evaluation and Training Group (TETG). Monitored services performed under 14 contracts valued at $15 million (annual average) including over 40 individuals working at five facilities. Ensured that all plans, schedules, work, deliverables and budgets in accordance with contract requirements. Prepared TETG annual operating budget, and contributed to annual business and marketing plans. * Boosted Funding for Test Program with Improved Processes. EWA saw the chance to expand programs from the Navy to the Army. Adapting the existing analysis, planning and testing to meet unique Army requirements, I established periodic reviews with the Army Test & Evaluation Command (ATEC), increasing test resource funding to $3.6M. * Designed and Implemented New Foreign Comparative Testing (FCT), Saving Time and Money. DOT&E was plagued with a poorly defined FCT review process. Adapting the existing processes, I developed a white paper and presentation, achieving government approval. I implemented new processes, reducing the review time to just 3 weeks and saving $120K. * Improved Business Outcomes on Government Contracts. EWA lacked operational efficiency and suffered project cost overruns. I implemented formalized project management methodologies, processes and reporting procedures, and monitored all services performed under 14 contracts valued at $35M. Improving contract performance, I reduced costs and overhead $210K annually. Successful Proposal Management. Led EWA team for several key competitive proposals for DoD. Designated as proposal manager when EWA was prime; when EWA was subcontractor, served as EWA’s proposal manager.

title: Project Engineer / Aviator
description: Serving as an active-duty U.S. Navy Officer and U.S. Navy Reserve Officer, I was a key contributor to the Office of Naval Research Blue Book, providing feasibility analysis of advanced technology initiatives. I supported cooperative research with allied foreign navies. I also led the design, procurement and integration activities of 15 engineers in a three-phase $70M project for the Caribbean Regional Operations Center. Naval Flight Officer, Electronic Countermeasures Officer (ECMO), Mission Commander and Avionics Maintenance Officer for EA-6B squadron. Conducted numerous electronic intelligence (ELINT) and signals intelligence (SIGINT) missions. Developed, tested and championed installation of modified mission suite for AN/ALQ-99 system on the Navy’s EA-6Bs that increased frequency coverage of its electronic surveillance capability.
headquarters:

title: Principal Analyst / Systems Engineer
description: Conducted acquisition analyses of numerous weapons and electronics programs for Naval shipboard and aviation systems. Developed test requirements that supported Navy’s Test Resource Analysis and Planning process. Key project contributions included: * Analyzed over 40 acquisition programs, such as AN/SPY-1D, Standard Missile, AN/ALR-67, F/A-18, EA-6B, and Joint Stand-Off Weapon. * Developed tailored requirements-analyses and SOW specifications of EW systems for Naval Surface Warfare Center (Dam Neck, VA); Integrated Battlespace Arena at Naval Air Warfare Center (China Lake, CA); EW Directorate of the Naval Air Warfare Center (Patuxent River, MD); and Joint Interoperability Test Command (Fort Huachuca, AZ). * Supported Chief of Naval Operations as Navy representative to multi-service Resource Enhancement Project, which corrected near-term critical resource deficiencies for operational test and evaluation requirements. Prepared subproject descriptions, justifications, funding profiles and schedules.

title: Intelligence Planner
description: Lead planner within the Intelligence Control Division (ICD), G-2 Directorate, U.S. Army Africa (USARAF), for North Africa, West Africa, Central Africa, East Africa, South Africa, and the Transnational African planning issues. - Develops, reviews, and revises war plans and contingency operations plans. Provides guidance and technical assistance in the development of plans and orders to support real world contingencies and military training exercises. Plans, coordinates, evaluates, and integrates actions required to support current and future USAFRICOM operational missions. - Assesses operational readiness and determines capability of units, commanders and staff elements; develops, reviews and revises military training plans and standards. Analyzes and coordinates theater and national operations and contingency plans, as well as joint and service specific doctrinal publications. Executes detailed contingency and crisis action planning. Contributes to Strategic Communications concepts and plans as required. Ensures intelligence focus on major theater of war contingency operations, and updates intelligence products. - Coordinates with operations personnel, deploy to attend conferences, meetings, conduct reconnaissance and write military orders. Prepares intelligence planning products and participates in the integrated staff Military Decision Making Process (MDMP) as well as the Adaptive Planning Process. - Represents USARAF Intelligence Directorate by conducting daily liaison with joint, allied, coalition, and subordinate intelligence planning activities. Works within the established planning priorities and makes recommendations on the validation of requirements for intelligence support.

title: Liaison Officer to Commander EUCOM
description: Served as EUCOM Liaison Officer for JSOC, responsible for representing COMJSOC in-theater activities, capabilities, plans, policy, exercises, & strategy to EUCOM Cdr & staff and SOCEUR. Served as special missions subject matter expert to EUCOM, other major commands, other theater combatant commands, JCS, DOD, & National Agencies. Facilitated planning ISO course of action (COA) development & subsequent JTF operations in European Theater. Conducted liaison with Theater Commands, inter-agencies & USSOCOM to meet JSOC plans, policy, & exercise objectives to enhance interoperability. Developed, coordinated, & implemented all matters of special operations plans, policy, exercises, and strategy as they related to JSOC in the EUCOM Area of Responsibility (AOR) while working with interagency working groups, National agencies, DOD agencies, U.S. intelligence agencies, and other commands. Worked as a team builder to foster consistent interpretation among JSOC personnel, its associated agencies, & directorates of pertinent plans, policy and exercises. Provided advice & recommendations to senior leaders, distinguished visitors, & other dignitaries on sensitive national plans, policies, & doctrine & how they relate to joint missions. Performed as the JSOC subject matter expert for operational missions, plans, & policies, which affected national security & European operations. Reviewed & analyzed OPLANS & CONPLANS for suitability, feasibility, acceptability, technical accuracy, adequacy, & integration of special mission operations content.

description: CSIO is a Corporate entity with 5,500 Consultants and Analysts serving and providing Intelligence Services to the U.S.Government; Intelligence Agencies. Corporate Services include Training, Intelligence Reporting, Consulting, and Top Secret Mission Success and Acceptance Planning. The mission of Studies in Intelligence is to stimulate within the Intelligence Community the constructive discussion of important issues of the day, to expand knowledge of lessons learned from past experiences, to increase understanding of the history of the profession, and to provide readers with considered reviews of public literature concerning intelligence. All statements of fact, opinion, or analysis expressed in Studies in Intelligence and CSIO Publications are those of the Authors. They do not necessarily reflect official positions or views of the Central Intelligence Agency or any other US government entity, past or present. Nothing in the contents should be construed as asserting or implying US government endorsement of an article's factual statements and interpretations. CSIO Offers Certifications for the Intelligence Community. No Other Intelligence Institution Offers this LEVEL of Predictive Analysis, delevoped in a real life situation. title: Performance Practitioner to Healthcare Design
description: Strategic & Operational Improvement focuses on Healthcare Administration performance; focusing on lean six sigma training and certification. Operations Excellence Advisor to Out-Patient Oncology and Surgical Hospital Operations. Scope of Responsibilities: Develop lean organizational Business Transformation Team to achieve higher Press-Ganey Quality National Scores. Provide Value Analysis for Operational Efficiency and Effectiveness. Key Accomplishments: •Achieved Press-Ganey quality scores from, 1st Quartile (Bottom) to 4th Quartile, (Top) in National Quality Peer Groups. •Developed workforce in Patient Focused, Process Orientated (PFPO) Operations Management applying accountability on responsibility using cross-functional team based culture with the meaning of end-to-end ownership. •ROI for EMR paper waste reduction resulted in a savings of over $600K based on 254 new cases annually. •Developed through Finance/Business Intelligence department, forecast matrix queries on material expenditures, and total labor clinical costs. Cost per Patient-Established and New. Reduced Patient Costs by $75.00 / Case. •Eliminated process waste and handling with Value Stream mapping and analysis. Cut hidden duplication of services and rework loops. This saved the Clinical Team $250K Annually. •Discovered a 40% patient billing process error by the lack of having a Pyxis pharmacy system. Annual loss to clinic operations was over $100k. •Developed Activity Based Accounting, versus blended accounting rules. This flushed out operational imbalance and activities of low value–high cost processes. Adaptation of this financial engineering system will be applied throughout all operations. •Boosted clinical operations capacity at a 40% increase, opening up Business Development, and furthering marketing potential intake. •Reengineered IT Billing, claims and registration processes, eliminating duplications, enhancing system performance.

title: Vice President- Process Improvement
description: Scope of Responsibilities: As an internal consultant for a 2 Year Program Initiative; transform the Banking operations into a lean and defect free work environment by being a Strategic Business partner for each business line of operations. Lead, manage and develop projects to completion using project management skills. Report on dotted line to senior executive management. Train and create a Center of Excellence in Continuous Improvement; by training and certifying enterprise wide workforce in Lean Six Sigma operational excellence, increase shareholder earning per shares. Key Accomplishments: The first two waves of students yielded $1.3 million and $2.3 million on Hard Savings for productivity improvements and defect reduction. Of the 28 manager/students who went through the CCIP program, (Certified Continuous Improvement Program) 20 were promoted as a direct result of their accomplishments. VERY NOTABLE: This OP-EX program set the stage for M&T (for upon their execution to act on.) to save $100 Million ($0.97 Earning Per Share) internal operations, including cross sell screening for new sources in revenue. Approximately $1 Billion was found, this was from process orientating the products statically to the Social Demographics, this freed up new sales potential for the M&T Bank RM's. Other merit objectives accomplished; Sr. Process Manager for Alternative Banking. Streamlined and transformed call center with efficiency gains of up to 40 FTE reduction netting an equivalent of $1.4 Million in annual savings. Consumer Asset Management-Collections, and Mortgage Risk Mitigation: As a leading contributor to a process team initiative; 40 projects were completed yielding $1.37 million in annual savings. Reduction in charge offs; dialer efficiency and effectiveness from applying "Champion / Challenger" Design Of Experiments, Transformed and streamlined IT collection systems thru re-engineering initiatives. Alternative Banking: Statistically tuned Mobile WAP Banking.

title: Sr. Process Performance Manager
company: University at Buffalo-Post Doctorate Higher Level Education & Development
description: Scope of Responsibilities: Turnaround companies/organizations’, which are performing poorly, manage and create content, consult using skills as a Master Black Belt for industry outreach design in any industry. Teach, mentor, and certify professional and academic students in Lean and Six Sigma Process/Project Management. Key accomplishments: Appointed to Erie County's Board of Directors for Six Sigma; Executive goal: Reduce variation and cut waste and redundant business processes. Served as interim Executive Director for Erie County's Six Sigma program. In addition; during this time; over 250 students in Lean six sigma were trained and certified as either Master Black Belts, Black Belts, Green Belts or Blue Belts. Primary content developer and producer for Certified Blended Learning Black Belt (CSSBB) program, the Certified Lean Professional (CLP), Certified Lean Master (CLM) and the Certified Master Black Belt Program (CSSMBB). Established a new vertical for healthcare, delivering and developing the "Blue Belt" Program (JCAHO sanctioned). Obtained over 200 hours in studio producing e-blended learning content. Mentored graduate students in Black Belt; projects yielding each over $1.0 million in corporate sponsored programs. Lead Design effort for state of the art Subsea Factory Systems. Major Oil and Gas. 12.5 MW power @ 15 Million Cubic Meters of gas per day. Ultra-High Efficient CO Sequester Turbines Master Black Belt for the Town of Clarence Government. Transactional projects "speed of cost reviews" and the "costing of such reviews" for the planning department. Second Core Department Project: "Fee schedules" for the parks department. Targeted areas, maintenance schedules; rooting out variation by creating predictive maintenance downtime and controlled costs to revenue ratio's. Clarence; this was the first town to become certified in Lean Six Sigma, results showed hard savings. The first year results were $175K with perpetual growth going forward.

title: Sr. Business Process Development Leader
description: Scope of Responsibilities: Develop Performance Management throughout entire Organization. Key Accomplishments: •Promoted to Sr. Business Process Development Leader (Space and Defense Division wide) •Transformed Division turning a $120 million bottleneck into revenue generation. (SPEED TO MARKET) Financial yield savings, as a result, netted cash flow excess of $2.4 million; $300K in direct labor costs. Saved worldwide operations totaling more $10+ million, positive cash flow relief reapplied to CI •DFSS Teams applied cut development time by 200%. Financial direct labor savings yielded $640 K annually •Managed 26 Defense Development programs; totaling $7-$25M each. Created Predictive Program Management =20% reduction schedule time using Pull and applied statistics on T-matrices, Earned Value Management System (EVMS) (PMP+LSS) •Sr. Program-Proposal DEV Mgr for US NAVY CVN-21 program compromising 7 teams, 132 personnel - Advance Weapons System (AWS), Nuclear Reactor Doors •Sr. Program-Proposal DEV Mgr for US NAVY DDG-1000 Stealth “Shocker” Destroyer-Land-Attack-Optimized. DLAO • Sr. Program-Proposal Dev Mgr for Naval Special Warfare Development Group (NSWDG) •DEVGRU PDLT Special Ops Leader: 29 cross functional Leadership Team Group •Lead 56 DOD projects by creating Special Ops. Integrator Teams •DFMAT PFCAS Proto Engineer for Boeing-Sikorsky RAH-66 Comanche Stealth-Helo •METL for F-35 Stealth Fighter •Sr. PM for Lockheed Martin Atlas V Rocket •Sr. Dev PM for Non-Line of Sight Launch System (NLOS-LS) •Sr. PM X-47B (RQ-170 Sentinel) UCAV •Invented, Digital Pulse Wide Modulation Valve (DPWM) for DARPA. Valve response performed at 10Khz+ for hypersonic flights. Piezo wafer stack deployed precision actuation and feedback, device incorporated GPS programming to control drift/ hysteresis. Valve cost reduction while breaking barriers. Product cost savings $900/unit. Developed advanced materials, using Terfenol-D, and meta-material resonator elements.

title: Plant Manager
description: Scope of Responsibilities: Managed 100+ workforce in a four (4) shift, 7 day per week operation. Reduced scheduling and business cycle time variation using lean techniques, training, and predictive maintenance. Establish Business-to-Business and Business to Customer Flow, throughput and on time quality delivery systems. Key Accomplishments: •Boosted profits and increased revenue intake from $4.5M to $6.11M. Developed standard procedures for ISO 9000 policies. •Introduced CERBIDE (NON-COBALT BINDING SUPER WEAR MATERIAL) Into Production systems, thermal transference, filtration, and centrifuge reclaim processes, CNC 5 axis grinders, and new material product research introductions. •Design, Develop Single piece PolyCrystalline Diamond, Formed Cutting tools for High Performance Jet Engine Applications. •Full P&L Accountability, responsible for accounts receivable, payable and finance.

title: Program Manager
description: Scope of Responsibilities: Appointed to Presidents council and PMO managing an $800M new capital program reporting into CEO on bimonthly basis. Accountable for Union labor, 400 direct reports, negotiation, Quality Operator performance, vendor management, supplier performance, all machining, assembly and testing for steering and suspension systems. Accountable for PPAP (Production Part Approval Process) on a 28-day continuous run for machining, assembly and test. Design Input/output distribution of inventory with “lean turn” methods. Key Accomplishments: • Promoted from Sr. Process Engineer to Program Manager • Developed End-to-End TQM accountably including supply chain management, process development, and financial engineering; including G&L and P&L for expenditure and revenue. Leaned business management system boosting speed market penetration. Reduced cycle time from 912 days to 677 days. This yielded a 25% net cash flow relieved, boosting internal capacities. The result was a $5.7M cash relief. • Awarded Patent for DC Servo driven Rack and Pinion Auto Toe Set product and process assembly, "dialing out" vehicle assembly variation. Process Variation reduction and error proofing was applied to core business processes and its design resulting in 12.0 Cpk assembly quality, and 1 DPBO errors. This new design replaced a unit which was costing GM $23M / year in scrap, rework, and warranty. All designs world wide classed against. 4:1 Strength ratio in jounce-rebound and life cycle...

title: Field Service Engineer I
description: Avionics technician maintaining sensor systems for King Air B300, including BE20, BE30 aircraft. Provide IT, Satellite communication, and video management in support of 24-hour Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) missions. Sensor integration. Maintenance of communication, cryptographic, and beyond line of sight (BLOS) equipment including Imagery and Communications Intelligence. Responsible for system administration, network monitoring, remote terminal commissioning, routine preventive maintenance, equipment problem tracking, and network problem resolution. Install new software, hardware, and configure peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and operational requirements. Perform scheduled and unscheduled mission system maintenance as required on King Air B300. Read and interpreted maintenance manuals, service bulletins, and other specifications to determine the feasibility and method of repairing or replacing malfunctioning or damaged components. Conducted routine and special inspections as required by regulations, maintained repair logs, documenting all preventive and corrective aircraft maintenance. Qualified MX-15 Electro Optical Sensor Operator onboard King Air B300. Working directly with tactical customers to facilitate the most effective employment of a dynamic suite of airborne sensors during real-time combat and sustainment operations. Advanced understanding of the fundamentals of air-ground integration and tactical voice communications.Performs additional duties as assistant Contractor Special Security Officer by administering the receipt, control, and accountability of Sensitive Compartmentalized Information (SCI) materials and the SCI security functions for contractor facilities. Develops, implements, and monitors SCI security policies and procedures; ensures compliance with all aspects of the security program.

title: PGSS Operator/Technician for NAVAIR 4.5x Special Surveillance Programs
description: Sensor Operator for NAVAIR 4.5x Special Surveillance Programs on TCOM 22M+ and 28M Aerostat utilizing WESCAM Mx-15i, Kestrel, FLIR 380 and Vista RADAR. Provides Improvised Explosive Device (IED) detection, indirect fire detection (IDF), security over watch for US troops, ODA, OGA and allied forces. Provides insurgent detection and tracking, pattern of life development (POL), counter-narcotics detection, pre-strike collateral damage evaluation and post strike battle damage assessment (BDA). Provided real time target development to US and coalition Special Forces and Battle Space Commanders. Provides Battle Space Commanders with up to date meteorological conditions and 12-72 hour forecasts. Performs Flight Engineer duties monitoring all parameters of flight telemetry. Performs duties as Launch and Recovery Director, ensuring safe aerostat deployment and retrieval. Prepare comprehensive reports, presentations, maps, based on collection, and analysis of intelligence data. Evaluate communications to plot activity and determine the size and location of groups and members. Maintain software applications, such as geographic information systems (GIS) mapping and artificial intelligence tools and maintain databases. Operate and repair Cloud Cap Technology Piccolo Autopilot. Proficient in use of ASTS inventory tracking software and FIGO maintenance tracking software.

title: LiDAR Field Technician
description: Airborne LiDAR system operator performed a 4000 miles aerial survey of high power transmission lines for Entergy Corporation. Operating windows based Riegl 680i LiDAR system. Employed, diagnosed and repaired LiDAR system and associated systems. Ensured 100% mission data collection rate. Collected geospatial data, using technologies such as aerial photography, light and radio wave detection systems, digital satellites, and thermal energy systems. Verified integrity and accuracy of data contained in remote sensing image analysis systems. Integrated remotely sensed data with other geospatial data. Consulted with remote sensing scientists, surveyors, cartographers to determine project needs. Adjusted remotely sensed images for optimum presentation by using software to select image displays, define image set categories, or choose processing routines. Manipulated raw data to enhance interpretation, either on the ground or during remote sensing flights. Merged scanned images or build photo mosaics of large areas, using image processing software. Participated in the planning or development of mapping projects. Prepared documentation or presentations, including charts, photos, or graphs. Corrected raw data for errors due to factors. Performed daily servicing and maintenance of Bell 206 Jet Ranger

title: Mission Commander - Airborne Sensor Operator
description: Airborne EO/IR sensor operator supporting U.S. Army and NATO forces in Kosovo and Iraq. Directly supported U.S. Army Joint Expeditionary SIGINT Tactical Reconnaissance (JESTR) missions, U.S. Air Force Project Liberty, Task Force ODIN, Other Department Agencies (ODA) and Other Government Agency (OGA) missions using EO/IR sensor system. Managed electronic systems, providing aerial security, full motion, color video and infrared imagery, target correlation based on signal intelligence, convoy route clearance. Real time imagery analysis. Provided real time target development to US Special Forces and Battle Space Commanders. Maintained, employed, MX-15 electro optical camera system. Operated Harris PRC-117 secure communications system. Proficient in Falcon View software. Corporate level airborne sensor systems electronics instructor/trainer. Assist in performing daily servicing, phase and unscheduled maintenance on Cessna 337. Read and interpreted maintenance manuals, service bulletins, and other specifications to determine the feasibility and method of repairing or replacing malfunctioning or damaged components.

title: LiDAR Operator
description: Temporary employment, helping them complete their contractual obligations. Airborne LiDAR system operator performing a 2000 mile aerial survey of high power transmission lines for Sunflower Power and Georgia Power and Light. Effectively partnered and communicated with ground based survey crews to ensure adequate weather station and GNS base station transmission line coverage on a daily basis. Operating windows based Harrier 56 LiDAR system. Maintained, employed, diagnosed and repaired Harrier 56 LiDAR system and associated electronic systems. Reported daily on mission electronics system status. Ensured 100% mission data collection rate.

title: P-3 In-flight Technician Subject Matter Expert
description: P-3 In-flight Technician Subject Matter Expert with LSI for NAVAIR PMA-290, P-3 Pakistan Navy Aircrew Training Program. P-3 In-Flight Technician course developer and classroom/flight instructor. Developed 1500 hours of classroom and flight instruction. Designed training curriculum for optical imaging camera systems, RADAR, COMSEC radio sets, GPS navigation, acoustic data collection and recording devices. Monitored, evaluated, or recorded training activities or program effectiveness. Assessed training needs through interviews with employees, managers and instructors. Developed alternative training methods if expected improvements are not seen. Organized and develop, or obtain, training procedure manuals, guides and course materials. Presented information using a variety of instructional techniques or formats, such as role playing, simulations, team exercises, group discussions, videos, or lectures. Evaluated training materials prepared by instructors, such as outlines, text, or handouts. Design, planned, organized and directed orientation and training for customers. Monitored training costs, and prepared budget reports to justify expenditures. Responsible for the technical and operational accuracy of subject matter during the analysis, design and development of P-3 systems, subsystems, or equipment courseware. Developed computer based aviation training courseware for classroom training and self-paced instruction. Validated the accuracy of the applicable P-3 systems, subsystems, or equipment. Interfaced with design team to ensure accurate content, meets standards, and contractual requirements. Reviewed courseware and tactical publications to identify and correct inaccurate data.

title: P-3 In-flight Technician/Fleet Instructor
description: Performed in-flight duties for the completion of combat, reconnaissance, transport, and SAR missions. Duties include operating aircraft communications and detection equipment, establishing satellite linkages, conducting pre-flight, in-flight, and post-flight inspections of onboard equipment; operating and maintaining aircraft weapons and defensive systems; operating and maintaining aircraft refueling systems; executing aircraft safety and emergency procedures; computing and verifying passenger, cargo, fuel, and emergency and special equipment weight and balance data; and conducting cargo and personnel drops. Advanced sensor system operations (location, identification and tracking of targets) in a maritime environment using APS-137 ISAR Radar, APS-115 Surface Search Radar and MX-20 optical system. Tactical communications/Airborne command and control (C2) (coordinating and directing ground and water borne assets) during counter-drug interdiction operations. Rigged targets for imagery collection. Operates Identification Friend or Foe (IFF) system and Automatic Identification System (AIS). Responsible for the preflight, maintenance, employment and diagnosis of aircraft electronic sensors to include: Optical imaging camera systems, UHF/VHF/HF/Satellite communication, inertial and GPS navigation, data collection and recording devices, RADAR, acoustic and non-acoustic electronic systems. Responsible for maintaining and troubleshooting all avionics and electronic systems. Squadron Crew Resource Management (CRM) Facilitator, Squadron level NATOPS Evaluator.

title: SH-60 Avionics Maintainer/Functional Checkflight Crewman
description: Aircraft Electronics and Line Operations shift supervisor for 7 personnel. Aircraft Electronics Lead Electronics Technician Supervisor for 15 personnel. Subject Matter Expert on H-60 Avionics and Weapon Systems. Subject Matter Expert in Helicopter Vibration Analysis and Main Rotor Track and Balance Responsible for short notice, high stress timely troubleshooting and repair of preflight and unscheduled maintenance discrepancies on H-60 Seahawk aircraft. Responsible for troubleshooting secure UHF, HF, Data-link and Satellite communication electronics systems on H-60 helicopters. Repaired Navigation, Communication and mission essential electronic systems to include UHF/VHF/HF radios, GPS navigation, dipping sonar, and Hellfire missile system. Performed daily COMSEC loads on aircraft systems using KYK-13 and CYZ-5 encrypted loading devices. Technical experience with grounding wires, cannon plugs and troubleshooting and repair of coaxial wire harnesses. Working maintenance knowledge and repair of Data bus networks. Read and interpreted maintenance manuals, service bulletins, and other specifications to determine the feasibility and method of repairing or replacing malfunctioning or damaged components. Conducted routine and special inspections as required by regulations, maintained repair logs, documenting all preventive and corrective aircraft maintenance. Inspected completed work to certify that maintenance meets standards and that aircraft are ready for operation. Extensive knowledge of the OPNAV 4790 series maintenance publications. Collateral Duty Inspector (CDI) for both Aviation Electronics (AT) weapons systems and Line Operations. Examined and inspect aircraft components, including landing gear, hydraulic systems, and deicers to locate cracks, breaks, leaks, or other problems. Performed rotor head change, main, intermediate and tail gearbox change and engine changes. Inspected airframes for wear. Completed over 500 functional check flight hours.

title: Framing Worker
description: •Use tools ranging from common hand and power tools, such as hammers, hoists, saws, drills, and wrenches, to precision measuring instruments and electrical and electronic testing devices. •Perform routine preventive maintenance to ensure that machines continue to run smoothly, building systems operate efficiently, or the physical condition of buildings does not deteriorate. •Inspect, operate, or test machinery or equipment to diagnose machine malfunctions. •Diagnose mechanical problems and determine how to correct them, checking blueprints, repair manuals, or parts catalogs, as necessary. •Assemble, install, or repair wiring, electrical or electronic components, pipe systems, plumbing, machinery, or equipment. •Inspect drives, motors, and belts, check fluid levels, replace filters, or perform other maintenance actions, following checklists. •Clean or lubricate shafts, bearings, gears, or other parts of machinery. •Adjust functional parts of devices or control instruments, using hand tools, levels, plumb bobs, or straightedges. •Repair or replace defective equipment parts, using hand tools and power tools, and reassemble equipment. •Record type and cost of maintenance or repair work

title: Route Driver
description: •Obey traffic laws and follow established traffic and transportation procedures. •Inspect and maintain vehicle supplies and equipment, such as gas, oil, water, tires, lights, or brakes, to ensure that vehicles are in proper working condition. •Report any mechanical problems encountered with vehicles. •Present bills and receipts and collect payments for goods delivered or loaded. •Load and unload trucks, vans, or automobiles. •Verify the contents of inventory loads against shipping papers. •Turn in receipts and money received from deliveries. •Maintain records, such as vehicle logs, records of cargo, or billing statements, in accordance with regulations. •Read maps and follow written or verbal geographic directions. •Report delays, accidents, or other traffic and transportation situations to bases or other vehicles, using telephones or mobile two-way radios.

title: Deputy, Maritime and Joint C2 Business Portfolio
description: This portfolio is dedicated to engineering and development IPTs for command and control to enable decision superiority. Engineering IPTs for command and control systems and application development for command, control, and decision support systems are part of this portfolio. This portfolio is focused on the utilization of information and decision aids to support decision making. This portfolio also includes the development and engineering of tactical data links and associated tactical data processors and integration of command and control systems to weapon systems. Systems of systems integration and testing focused on command and control systems as well as overarching C4ISR systems of systems engineering. Integration and test of command and control application software within the network computing utility is included. Application integration with dedicated command, control, and tactical data link hardware.

description: INTELLIGENCE ANALYST INSTRUCTOR/MANAGER – Develop curriculum packages used for overseas contingency operations to ensure intelligence analysts were prepared to meet deployment requirements. Manage course schedules and assigned instructors as needed within our nine state region. Develop and update curriculum for multiple analytic tradecraft courses. - Provided mentorship in support of major certification exercises and helped bridge the knowledge gap between multiple intelligence disciplines - Initiated process improvements that ensured timely completion and improved team skills application for numerous training events - Equal opportunity leadership adviser to the commander, keeping him informed of unit climate and personnel policy updates - Primary liaison for advising senior Army Reserve and Army National Guard staff on intelligence training requirements in a nine state region - Managed SharePoint folders and calendars and coordinated with outside entities to properly share and extend information as needed

title: S2 NCOIC
description: INTELLIGENCE MANAGER - Supervised a team of six intelligence analysts and maintained confidential security clearance administrative data for an organization of over 600 personnel. - Coordinated three simultaneous projects on Camp Phoenix, Afghanistan which resulted in increased safety and base security in a complex high density urban environment - Organized and executed meetings with senior staff and external stakeholders in resource and time constrained environments - Conducted numerous consultations with local Afghan citizens over grievances about land issues, compensation claims and base employment - Managed planned and unscheduled events on the senior Intelligence Officer’s calendar and insured he was properly briefed on topics or attendee issues of concern - Assigned as special security officer and courier to properly manage and transport all classified documents and correspondence throughout the Afghanistan theater of operations

title: Operations NCO, Battalion AGR Senior Enlisted Adivsor
description: SENIOR INTELLIGENCE ANALYST – Managed a team of four intelligence unit administrators and reviewed daily intelligence products to prepare situation reports used by senior staff. Researched areas of concern that could affect the operational environment and disrupt future planning. Ensured compliance with operational security and Department of Defense security classification policies. - Served as special projects analyst for a counterintelligence analysis cell as well as provide support for external consumers - Enhanced information development for major combat operations from human intelligence, counterintelligence and other government agency sources - Planned and documented training requirements for an organization of almost 300 people, as well as advised the commander of budgetary constraints to accomplish long term objectives - Worked personally with unit commander to establish training goals, warn about employee medical readiness status and family support program

title: Fire Direction Center, Computer Operator
description: Establishes, maintains and operates radio and wire communications. Operates the backup computer system to include; preparation, entry of known data, and computation of firing data. Constructs and operates observed or surveyed firing charts. Records fire mission related information and maintains ammunition status. Compiles lists and prepares target overlays, and situation and fire capability overlays. Operates and performs operator maintenance on section vehicles and generators. Performs crew maintenance and participates in organizational maintenance of section equipment.

title: Link-Belt
description: •Develop and implement a companywide International Compliance SOP for US customs • Assisted in the development of the HTS USER guide on the internal web site • Completed the classification of 160,000 parts for Link-Belt HTS database with 100% accuracy • Actively seeking to become a Licensed Customs Broke for the company • Deal with 3Party Logistics in classification and successful deliveries of 500 or more shipments • Saved the company over $5,000.00 in education funds, by finding alternative forms of funding to obtain important certifications and increasing my technical knowledge • Contribute to export compliance program by carrying out proper process concerning harmonizing classification, records retention, denied parties and other departmental support as needed. • Assist the Import Machine Scheduler with day to day operations of clearing machines and parts through U.S. Customs, issuing the pickup/delivery notices to assigned transportation carriers. • Complete monthly insurance filings of all international whole goods and parts shipment. • Process all related international freight bills and invoices by correct account code as well prorating cost by machines purchase orders for standard costs on import products. Also verify rates are correct based on contract tariffs applied. • Assist with scheduling delivery of ocean containers and ocean shipments and processing all parts with proper harmonizing classifications in accordance with general rule of Interpretation, country or origin, and licensing requirements. • Monitor import/export documents for proper records retention compliance. Maintain and destroy documents per regulations and company policy. • Process the export screenings for the denied parties list, including updating a periodic log sheet. • Assist other departmental staff on an as needed basis; participate in others special projects or duties assigned.

title: Case Technician
description: • Provide full range of clerical and technical support for Administrative Law Judges and other technical professional positions • Review and analyze medical and legal documentation; record and evidence to ensure that OHA case files are received and developed in accordance with legal and regulatory authorities. • Schedule cases for hearing in accordance with legal and regulatory requirements • Coordinate time and date of hearing; arrange for space, schedule all participants, prepare itineraries and prepare travel vouchers. • Examine fee agreements received from representatives for proper criteria before presentation to the ALJ for signature. • Maintain, review, update and utilize a variety of data systems to ensure timely scheduling of hearings, proper case flow, and equitable distribution of workload and proper payment of services, travel, supplies and equipment.

title: Senior Operations and Security Manager * Project Manager
description: Led strategic operations, multiple projects, and combat operations and training; managed, directed and trained 25-40 personnel in highly classified missions and industrial projects worldwide through exceptional planning, coordination and execution Developed procedures, made recommendations and oversaw multiple intelligence and security operations Identified and negotiated schedule requirements for direct and extended teams; drove development of teams to take assignments of increasing scope and complexity Engaged in multi-disciplinary classified intelligence projects, and training and promoting US government's security operations in Iraq Managed 53 personnel and provided tactical training of various battle tanks and related equipment repair valued in excess of $4.5M as well as security patrol of over 2700 kilometers of Iraqi terrain Directed reconnaissance of fording sites, tunnels and bridges; evaluated terrain, selected routes, assembled areas, analyzed firing positions and positions for combat operations Responsibilities frequently required regional orientation, working under highly classified information Briefed personnel in actual intelligence, logistical patterns, supply dilemmas and mission scenarios Delivered presentations and lectures to personnel, covering cross-cultural communications, foreign democracy, politics of a country, foreign internal defense, religious believes and values, US foreign policies and legal aspects Oversaw planning, logistics and development of daily assignments, acting as liaison between personnel and senior officers; consolidated assignments and recommended particular resolutions to problems and/or obstacles Oversaw logistical coordination; conducted security investigations, reviewed r teaching highly technical and tactically complicated courses regarding operations, readiness, logistics, security, weaponry and administration Trained personnel, officers and managers; identified critical issues and solutions
skills: ["Operational Planning", "Logistics", "Certified Instructor", "Security Clearance", "Product Lifecycle...", "Project Management", "Coordination", "Leadership", "Training", "Army", "Operations Management", "Program Management", "Human Resources", "Project Planning", "Analysis", "Team Building", "Military", "Management", "Government", "Policy", "Transportation", "Leadership Development", "Military Operations", "Employee Relations", "Command", "Logistics Management", "Organizational...", "Personnel Management", "Organizational...", "Force Protection", "Warehouse Management", "Top Secret", "Weapons", "DoD", "Intelligence", "Military Experience", "Supervisory Skills", "Defense", "Military Logistics", "Security Operations", "Emergency Management", "Combat", "Military Training", "Intelligence Analysis"]

title: Management and Program Analyst
description: Perform a variety of quality control (QC) functions which include, but not limited to providing input into preparation of facility accident, incident, and occurrence packages; QC investigations Service Reviews, Quality Control Monitoring, Compliance Verification, Quality Control Checks and Quality Control Validations. Provides assistance to the processing of these reports. Independently produces voice recordings, and certifies re-recorded communications ensuring required content and prescribed timeframes. Produces and forwards requested recordings of specific events to supervisors for discussion with individual ATCSs. Ensures national and facility orders and notices pertaining to the Quality Control office are current. Assists in the training and/or instructing to all personnel entering into and/or assisting in QC funtions. Administers the SATORI program. Produces specific SATORI recreations and provides notification to the supevisors for timely completion of each review. Works with the Traffic Alert and Collision Avoidance System (TCAS) reporting program. Collects and forwards documentation to regional and national headquarters. Assists in facility evaluations and provides input to management for facility evaluation responses. Administers the various data bases used by the QC office. Serves as the Quality Control office subject matter expert for all radar and voice replay programs such as FACON, DALR, and SATORI H and E. FOIA package point of contact.

title: Time and Labor Specialist
description: Perform time keeping and attendance for the Kansas City Center Air Route Traffic Control Center. Receive and screen calls or visitors from private groups, military, or other government agency representatives or other FAA employees. Provide adequate and proper technical assistance to supervisors and employees regarding overtime, compensatory time, night differential, holiday, and Sunday pay as well as alternate work schedule, family leave, and GI Bill procedures. Furnish factual information in response to procedural inquiries concerning day-to-day operation and maintenance of employee leave and pay entitlements. File all time keeping materials within one week of completion. Certify payment for approximately 470 time and attendance records bi-weekly and meet all payroll deadlines efficiently. Maintain currency with the time and attendance procedures and directives. Assemble documents, and dispose of records in accordance with established time keeping laws. Maintain and track reports for FMLA/FFLA, Blood Leave and Award Leave. Prepare daily overtime usage reports in order to track overtime monies expended by the facility. Provide accurate and timely travel advice and arrangements according to FAA regulations.

title: Case Intake Specialist (Legal Assistant)
description: Paralegal for the Office of Disability Adjudication and Review. Run Master Docket for hearing office by multiple work load listings. Screen and process all incoming cases both paper and electronic. Research each case and compile information and documentation that is not in the file. Correctly enter each case in hearing office electronic systems. Process all incoming electronic file transactions and add updated information, or assign work load to Senior Case Technicians. Responsible for all transfers of cases both in and out of the hearing office. Responsible for all remanded cases sent back to the hearing office. Mail out cases that have been issued a decision by an Administrative Law Judge. Work up approximately 20 cases per month. Run multiple reports to locate and correct inaccurate or incomplete records. Assist in all system related corrections needed on a case at any point during the hearing office process. Assist in training of other employees at hearing office.

title: Team Leader
description: I spent five years as a 98G Spanish linguist in the 10th Mountain Division of the United States Army. During this time I was in charge of the compilation, analysis, investigation, and dissemination of foreign voice intelligence data to other government agencies including the FBI and CIA. Highly experienced in writing situational intelligence reports for superiors under shortened time lines with ever changing conditions. Experienced in field operations collecting intelligence while remaining covert. Experienced in concealment and tactical movement. Experienced in carrying and using multiple weapons platforms. Experienced in all aspect of SIGINT and have some experience in interrogation and information extraction. I was a Team leader of a 3-6 man team in two different combat areas of operations. All equipment used was primarily line of sight voice intercept equipment such as the PRD11, PRD12, and PRD 13. Also have experience on the TLQ and TRQ radio jamming equipment.

description: Supervises 16 Joint Active Duty and 13 Civil Service members respoinsible for the development of NBC related TTPs ● Spearheads the development of standardized organizational mission focus revealing critical manning shortfalls and materiel deficiencies. title: Surface Ordnance/IED Division Leading Chief Petty Officer/Instructor
company: EOD Training and Evaluation Unit TWO
description: ● Guided all aspects of curriculum development based on current enemy tactics and capabilities and sound experience. - Developed detailed EOD radiography curriculum that takes students from principles of x-ray generation to the most cutting edge x-ray diagnostic techniques. - Restructured IED Electronics curriculum in order to provide relevant information while utilizing a new instructional methodology resulting in better student comprehension. ● Managed High-Risk Training Evolution to include demolition evolutions. This position required daily one-on-one interaction with a diverse group of individuals. ● Developed and instructs classified Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTPs). - Authored EOD counter-light sensor EOD tactics based on research & empirical experimentation that resulted in a publicized study. ● Instructed Advanced EOD Techniques and Procedures - Demonstrates ability to take complex principles and theories and make them relevant to a diverse group of individuals. - Excels at adapting advanced techniques based on new technologies to solve emerging threats.

title: Requirements & Evaluations Division Officer
description: Led Human Factors Integration and assisted prototype development for EOD programs. ● Led the development of the characterization protocol for precision energetic disablement tools. This effort will serve as the mil standard for EOD shaped charges of the future. ● Developed, coordinated and supervised execution of test plans to ensure developmental prototypes are on track and engineer design models are capable of meeting fleet requirements by conducting Human Factors Testing and Limited Engineering Tests. ● Briefed Assistant Secretary of Defense Special Operations/Low-Intensity Conflict (ASD SO/LIC) and Defense Threat Reduction Agency (DTRA) Bold Gambler (BG) program manager on current program status and testing milestones. ● Implemented and managed joint service DOD and DOJ programs focused on testing and evaluation of prototype equipment. - Supervised resource allocation, scheduling, test plan preparation, evaluation procedures and final test report production. - Worked independently during extensive travel (over 100 days per year) maintaining contacts in industry and working with various DoD acquisition professionals. ● Developed EOD Combat Validation program to transition operator inputs to workable prototypes in order to satisfy specific EOD technological and equipment shortfalls. ● Developed concept, prototype and fielding plan to enable Man Transportable Robotic System (MTRS) to excavate and extricate buried UXO, trace and cut IED command wires as well as breaking automotive windows using unique end of arm tool. ● Validated current EOD X-ray generator penetration shortfalls and guided development of next generation capabilities and tactics. ● Conducted market survey, developed test plan and conducted Thermal Imaging Capability Review to expand special mission EOD teams operational capabilities.

title: Readiness LCPO
description: ● Certified EOD teams to perform their mission, managed secret publications program, and participated in field operations and training ● Team Leader of handpicked EOD Team supporting DOJ Operation Eastern Access. □ Prevented UXO hazards from impeding the movement of the FBI SWAT and other government agencies while directing movement and providing access to critical targets enabling the effective removal of protesters from the Active Impact Area, Vieques, PR. □ Supervised the clearance and removal of the protestor attempting to detonate an IED. ● Deployed to Mosul in support of OIF; responsible for planning, briefing , supervising and performing EOD duties in support of USMC, USA and Special Forces & Civil Affairs. ● Led EOD operations within an independently operating 18-42 man joint Army, Air Force, Marine and Navy force consisting of EOD, Special Forces ODA, Civil Affairs and Other Government Agency personnel in rural areas 45 minutes west of any Quick Reaction Force (QRF) support while conducting interviews with tribal leaders, area clearances and WMD searches. ● Conducted EOD and Force Protection Operations throughout Europe and the Middle East Nimble Elder (NE)/Bold Gambler (BG) Program Training Coordinator ● Developed EODMU TWO’s Special Operation Forces (SOF) EOD initial training capability -Coordinated and conducted initial training and final certification for SOF EOD Teams assigned to EODMU TWO. - Constructed advanced IED/WMD training aids required for training and certification of SOF EOD teams. LCPO of EODMU TWO Detachment 30 & 02
